title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the south shore, at the mouth of the River Almond, stand the village of Cramontl, and Cramoiid House, (Lady Torphichen), and a little further west is Dalmeny Parle, the seat of tlie P:arl of Rosebery. Near it are the ruins of Barnbougle Castle, an ancient seat of the family of the Moubrays. Directly opposite is Donibristle,  a seat of the Earl of Moray, the scene of the atrocious murder, by the Earl of Huntly, of the youthful Earl of Moray, son-in-law of the celebrated  Regent Moray.* A short way to the westward lies the ancient burgh of Inverkeithing.

title: Europe from May to December,
author: Williams, Rudolph.
snippet: Prime Minister of the Empire. We were shown the towers and those of its neighbor, Barnbougle Castle.
